name: OpenELEC Dev Update
body:
![Icon](https://raw.github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/master/icon.png)

**This add-on makes it easy to upgrade/downgrade OpenELEC development builds from a variety of sources, without leaving the XBMC interface. When you run the add-on manually you get a list of available builds from the specified source URL (configured in the add-on settings). There is also a service which runs in the background, so when a newer build becomes available, a notification will be shown to enable you to install the update.**

**To perform an update the add-on will download the (possibly bzip compressed) tar file and extract the SYSTEM and KERNEL update images, and the associated md5 checksum files, into the /storage/.update folder. The update will then be installed on the next reboot. This is all documented on the [OpenELEC wiki](http://wiki.openelec.tv/index.php/Updating_OpenELEC#Manually_Updating_OpenELEC)**.

-----------------------------

Please note that this is not an "official" OpenELEC add-on. If you hit any problems with it, don't ask for support from the OpenELEC team, please post on this [OpenELEC forum thread](http://openelec.tv/forum/128-addons/49855) or raise an [issue](https://github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/issues/new). If you have any comments/questions/suggestions please also post on the thread and I'll probably respond.

I would like to say a big thank you to the OpenELEC team for creating and maintaining an awesome product. Thanks also go out to the awesome people who create and host their own OpenELEC builds.

-----------------------------

Now for some cautionary messages, in caps for extra impact!

* **PLEASE BE AWARE THAT DEVELOPMENT BUILDS OFTEN HAVE MAJOR BUGS. YOU MAY EXPERIENCE FREQUENT CRASHES OR OTHER PROBLEMS WHEN USING THESE BUILDS.**

* **DO NOT USE A DEVELOPMENT BUILDS UNLESS THERE IS A SPECIFIC NEED, OTHERWISE STICK TO THE OFFICIAL STABLE BUILDS.**

* **IT IS BEST TO DO A FRESH INSTALL WHEN SWITCHING FROM A STABLE TO A DEVELOPMENT BUILD, AND VICE VERSA. OTHERWISE THERE COULD BE SOME CONFIGURATION ISSUES.**

* **IT IS ADVISED TO BACKUP THE USERDATA FOLDER WHEN UPDATING. THIS STEP CAN NOW BE AUTOMATED, THANKS TO THE XBMC BACKUP ADD-ON.**

-----------------------------

Here is the latest [changelog](https://raw.github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/master/changelog.txt).

## Installation

1. Install my XBMC repository from [xbmc.repo.leopold.zip](http://goo.gl/csQU8h).
1. Install **OpenELEC Dev Update** from **Leopold's Add-ons** under **Program Add-ons**.

Installing this way will ensure that the add-on is kept up-to-date as I push out updates to the repository.

## Sources

* Official Releases
* [Official Daily Builds](http://sources.openelec.tv/tmp/image) | [Forum](http://openelec.tv/forum/20-development-discussion/67846) 
* [Official Archive](http://archive.openelec.tv)
* [XBMCNightlyBuilds (Nightly Builds)](http://mirrors.xbmcnightlybuilds.com/OpenELEC_DEV_BUILDS)
* [XBMCNightlyBuilds (Official Stable Builds Mirror)](http://mirrors.xbmcnightlybuilds.com/OpenELEC_STABLE_BUILDS)
* [Chris Swan (RPi)](http://resources.pichimney.com/OpenELEC/dev_builds)
* [Rbej Gotham builds (RPi)](http://netlir.dk/rbej/builds/Gotham) | [Forum](http://forum.xbmc.org/showthread.php?tid=169674)
* [Rbej Frodo builds (RPi)](http://netlir.dk/rbej/builds/Frodo) | [Forum](http://forum.xbmc.org/showthread.php?tid=169674)
* [MilhouseVH builds (RPi)](http://netlir.dk/rbej/builds/MilhouseVH) | [Forum](http://forum.xbmc.org/showthread.php?tid=169674)

## Reporting Issues

If you get a script error or other problem please raise an [issue](https://github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/issues/new) or post on the [OpenELEC forum thread](http://openelec.tv/forum/128-addons/49855). If you can reproduce the problem then please include a debug log, by following these steps:

* [Turn on XBMC debugging](http://wiki.xbmc.org/index.php?title=Log_file#Enable_Debugging).
* Turn on the 'Debug' option in the add-on advanced settings.
* Restart XBMC to start a clean log.
* Run the add-on again to reproduce the error.
* Upload the debug log. There are a couple of ways:
 1. Log in via ssh and run pastebinit ~/.xbmc/temp/xbmc.log
 1. Use the add-on "XBMC Log Uploader".
